info.name: Cybersecurity Culture
info.results: Congratulations! Now the world will be a little safer thanks to you...

questions.q: What is cybersecurity awareness and why is it important?

a.option: It's the understanding of cyber threats and measures to protect information and online security.
It's antivirus software that protects computers from viruses and malware.
It's a law that regulates the use of the internet and social networks.
It's a way to control access to personal data on social networks.

questions.q: Why is cybersecurity awareness important for employees in a company?

a.option: To protect the company's data and systems from cyber attacks.
To increase employee productivity at work.
To reduce the cost of software licenses.
To improve the customer experience.

questions.q: What actions can a cybersecurity analyst take to promote a security culture in a company?

a.option: Organize training and awareness sessions on cybersecurity.
Send emails with security tips to employees.
Install antivirus software on company computers.
Block access to social networks at work.

questions.q: What executive roles within a company are responsible for cybersecurity culture?

a.option: CEO, CSO, and CISO.
IT Manager, HR Director, and Marketing Director.
Head of Physical Security, Accountant, and Operations Manager.
All employees of the company.

questions.q: How could you convince the CEO of a company without a cybersecurity culture of the importance of implementing one?

a.option: Present a report with data on cyber threats and the economic impact of attacks.
Threaten to resign if a cybersecurity culture is not implemented.
Share success stories of other companies that have implemented a cybersecurity culture.
Demand that the CEO take a cybersecurity training course.

questions.q: What is legal and regulatory compliance in cybersecurity?

a.option: Set of laws and regulations that organizations must comply with to protect information and mitigate cyber risks.
Antivirus software that protects computers from malware and viruses.
Set of standards for the design of websites and mobile applications.
Guide for creating strong and robust passwords.

questions.q: Why is legal and regulatory compliance important in cybersecurity?

a.option: It protects personal data, prevents data breaches, increases customer trust, and mitigates cyber risks.
It reduces the cost of software licenses and increases employee productivity.
It improves the user experience on social networks.
It decreases the amount of spam emails received by employees.

questions.q: What compliance measures can be implemented to meet cybersecurity security regulations?

a.option: Implement security policies and procedures, conduct risk assessments, and provide security training to employees.
Use parental control software to block inappropriate content on the internet.
Purchase data theft insurance to protect the company's financial information.
Disable the use of mobile devices at work to prevent unauthorized access.

questions.q: What are security standards and frameworks, such as ISO 27001, ENS, and NIST?

a.option: Frameworks and guidelines that help organizations implement compliance measures effectively.
Laws that regulate the use of the internet and social networks in different countries.
Certification programs for cybersecurity professionals.
Tools for password management and protection of personal data.

questions.q: What benefits does compliance with security standards and frameworks offer?

a.option: It improves security posture, protects information assets, and complies with security regulations.
It increases company sales and improves customer satisfaction.
It reduces the cost of maintaining computer systems.
It decreases the number of working hours for employees.
